intro: Triodia mollis, commonly known as the slender spinifex, is a hardy grass-like plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth and wiry, spiky leaves that help it thrive in arid environments. The plant is often found in sandy soils and is well adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or yellowish and appear in late summer. Triodia mollis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native fauna.
